subject: Leadership
title: Blue Ocean Strategy
description: A short lesson to help you apply Blue Ocean Strategy.

hook.text: Cirque du Soleil entered a dying circus industry and built a billion-dollar empire. They didn't competeâ€”they redefined.

buildup.text: Red oceans are crowded markets with fierce competition. Blue oceans are new spaces where competition is irrelevant.

discovery.text: Kim and Mauborgne: create blue oceans by eliminating, reducing, raising, and creating factors industries assume fixed.

twist.text: Blue oceans don't require invention. They require recombinationâ€”taking what exists and assembling it in a new way.

climax.text: Leaders create blue oceans by questioning industry assumptions and looking at non-customers for unmet needs.

punchline.text: Don't fight over shrinking pies. Bake a new one.

quiz.question: What is a blue ocean strategy?
options: Competing more aggressively in existing markets
